title: Local Residents Join Bizarre Slow-Speed Police Chase of DUI Suspect
content: On Thursday night, May 31, the Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) arrested a man suspected of DUI and car theft, after a slow-speed chase that lasted for around an hour.    LAPD first spotted the driver by the intersection of Tampa Avenue and Van Owen Street at around 10:15 p.m., according to Fox 11.    The police attempted at least nine PIT maneuvers and deployed four spike strips during the pursuit. However, the man kept driving at a very slow speed.    In addition, some members of the public even approached the car, including one man who tried to open one of the driver’s car door and another who kicked the car. Their actions were captured on ariel footage.    The chase ended at around 11:45 p.m., after the police performed a final PIT maneuver to cage the car in.
